processes.name: create-vpc
processes.description: Creates a new VPC to host your Wordpress EC2 instances - ensures network separation from other AWS resources

processes.name: create-subnet-1a
processes.description: Creates a subnet in zone A of the availability zone for the chosen region (NB - chose region and AZ in the Configurations code).

processes.name: create-default-keypair
processes.description: Creates a new keypair to build the Wordpress EC2 instance - this is used to access the instance via SSH.

processes.name: create-wordpress-secuirty-group
processes.description: Creates a security group to allow HTTP/HTTPS traffic inbound and also SSH access from your chosen public IP for deep level administration.

processes.name: create-wordpress-ec2
processes.description: Create Wordpress EC2 instance using the Bitnami ID (currently provided in the Configurations "wpAmi" variable)

processes.name: create-wp-sg-http
processes.description: Creates the rule which allows HTTP inbound from the internet (0.0.0.0/0).

processes.name: create-wp-sg-https
processes.description: Creates the rule which allows HTTPS inbound from the internet (0.0.0.0/0).

processes.name: create-wp-sg-ssh
processes.description: Creates the rule which allows SSH inbound from the public IP set in the Configurations (the "sshIngress" variable).

processes.name: slack-send-message
processes.description: Sends a Slack message to the channel set in the "slackChannel" variable in Configurations confirming EC2 has been created. (Ensure you have built an App and set the token value in the Vault).

processes.name: create-public-ip
processes.description: Creates an Elastic IP to associate with the Wordpress instance - this ensures the public IP address doesn't change.

processes.name: associate-public-ip
processes.description: Associates the Elastic IP creted previously with the Wordpress instance - this ensures the public IP address doesn't change.

processes.name: pause
processes.description: Pause for 60 seconds to allow VM creation

exportedPipeline.description: This pipeline will deploy a standalone Wordpress environment within AWS. It will build a new VPC and subnet within an AWS account, allocate an elastic IP, create an EC2 keypair and then deploy AWS security groups to control traffic in and out of the Wordpress instance, before finally sending a slack notification to indicate completion of the pipeline.
